_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

Facility: Trotter Fertilizer and Propane
City:Ord, NE.
Contact:John Felton
Phone:308-728-7722

1. Facility Policy.
      The owners, management, and employees of Trotter Fertilizer and Propane are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department,Valley County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to persons and the environment.

2. Facility Information.
      The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers and propane for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for the direct application as a vutrient for crop production. The maximum stored would be pounds in a storage tand and nurse tanks.    
      
3. The Worst-Case Release Senario and the Alternate Release Scenario
      Analysis of the potential off-sight consequences of hypothetical worst-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assesment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.Accidental Release Prevention Program.
      The facility is in compliance with the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storange and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3(b).

5. Five-year Accident History.
      There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor, to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuation, property damage, or enviromental damage.
  

6. Emergency Action Plan
      The facility has:
       a. A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38

;     
       b. Proovided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA)
       c. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency respinse numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan. 

7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety.
     
     Safety Improvements are an on-going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance and safe conditions of our equipment. There are no additional psecific angydrous ammonis safety recommendations at this time.
